technology: The participant experienced a brief audio issue at the beginning, but it was quickly resolved and didn't significantly impact the conversation.
cur_neg_affect: The participant expresses some mild frustration about having bad reactions to the vaccine and booster, but overall doesn't display strong negative affect about the present situation.
past_neg_affect: The participant describes feeling sad and disappointed about missing out on senior year experiences and having a virtual freshman year, indicating a somewhat negative affect when recalling the past.
communal_orientation: The participant actively listens to their partner, asks follow-up questions, and shares similar experiences, demonstrating a moderate level of communal orientation.
engagement: The participant is actively engaged in the conversation, sharing their experiences, asking questions, and responding thoughtfully to their partner's comments.
defensiveness: The participant does not exhibit any defensive behavior or statements.
questions: (08:51-08:56): So I guess, like when you deferred a quarter. When did you come back like, what? What quarter did you or like? When did you? Yeah, when did you come back?
(09:53-09:57): Yeah, what did you do during your year that you deferred?
(11:38-11:45): Yeah, did you end up having to get the vaccine for your return to campus? And like. How was that experience for you?
(13:44-13:47): Have you gotten like booster shots recently?
(15:18-15:23): Did you know anybody in your life that was like anti-vax?
(17:24-17:30): Is that something that you might get in the future? Or do you think you know due to your experiences? Maybe not.
(18:00-18:08): But I think I would. Yeah, what about you?
perspective_statements: (15:03-15:13): Totally me, too, like I didn't. Well, I didn't understand a lot of like the medical side of like vaccinations, and how it affects other people like you said, in addition to just yourself.
similarity_statements: (15:13-15:18): So I definitely like learned a lot and had a perspective change as well.
vaccine_importance: The participant seems to view vaccines as important, as they get the flu shot every year and would likely get the COVID vaccine annually as well, indicating a high level of importance.
booster_importance: The participant would have to do a bit more research on it, but would likely get the booster, indicating a high level of importance.
cognitive_complexity: The participant demonstrates cognitive complexity by acknowledging the changing perceptions of vaccines, considering the perspectives of others, and weighing the pros and cons of getting booster shots.
general_notes: The participant had a generally positive experience during the pandemic, but did express some disappointment about missing out on senior year experiences. They are open to getting future COVID boosters, but want to do more research first.
